intro: Galinsoga parviflora var. adenophora, commonly known as the common gallinsoga, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is an annual herb that typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in gardens and along roadsides. The plant features small, yellow flowers clustered in dense inflorescences, and its leaves are often hairy and serrated. It is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes. Botanically, it belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
